principles.name: Unconscious Approachability as Core Identity
principles.description: Being described as 'very approachable' was a revelation - 'I had never thought about that before... I don't know that I had ever been actually described as very approachable. I don't know, that's always stuck with me.' This represents an unconscious core trait.

principles.name: Innate Insight and Dot-Connection
principles.description: 'I've always been insightful, and people just rely on that. They just rely on me to connect the dots for them.' This is presented as a fundamental, unchanging aspect of identity.

principles.name: Loyalty Creation Under Adversity
principles.description: Ability to 'create an incredibly loyal group of people' even in hostile environments where 'all the parents invent reasons to hate you' demonstrates leadership under pressure.

patterns.name: Unconscious Core Trait Recognition
patterns.description: Sometimes core identity traits operate unconsciously until external feedback reveals them, becoming defining characteristics once recognized.
patterns.context: Self-awareness development where others' perspectives reveal fundamental aspects of personality that weren't previously conscious.

patterns.name: Hostile Environment Loyalty Building
patterns.description: Create loyalty and strong relationships even in adversarial contexts where structural opposition exists.
patterns.context: Leadership roles with built-in antagonism (like PTA president) where success requires overcoming systemic resistance.

examples.name: Elementary School PTA President Revelation
examples.content: Ten to fifteen years ago as elementary school PTA president, Dan created 'an incredibly loyal group of people' despite the role meaning 'all the parents invent reasons to hate you.' A parent described him as 'very approachable,' which was a revelation: 'I had never thought about that before... that's always stuck with me.'

examples.name: Core Identity - Insight and Dot-Connection
examples.content: When asked about intrinsic identity traits, Dan identifies being 'insightful' as fundamental: 'I've always been insightful, and people just rely on that. They just rely on me to connect the dots for them.'
